data.title: Polyphemus by Michael Shea
data.meta_description: Polyphemus by Michael Shea and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Condition: Good. Good condition. This is the average used book, that has all pages or leaves present, but may include writing. Book may be ex-library with stamps and stickers. 0.35.

Octavo, cloth. First edition. 3528 copies printed. Collects seven horror novellas including "The Autopsy" and "The Pearls of the Vampire Queen," a sequence from NIFT THE LEAN, winner of the 1983 World Fantasy Award. "Shea is one of the most visually powerful creators of horror images writing today." - Barron (ed), Horror Literature 4-269. Barron (ed), Fantasy and Horror (1999) 6-327. Barron (ed), Fantasy Literature 4A-230. A fine copy in fine dust jacket. (#174598).

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good+. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition; First Printing. B&W Drawings; 8vo 8" - 9" tall; 245 pages; 1987 Arkham House Publishers. HC/DJ 1st edition, stated. Snugly bound in uniformly bright wraparound color pictorial dust jacket with publisher's $16.95 issue price intact to unclipped front flap. Just very mild shelf rubbing to jacket edges and flap folds. Illustrated with b&w drawings by John Stewart. VG++/VG+ or better.

First edition. Octavo, cloth. Collects seven horror novellas including "The Autopsy" and "The Pearls of the Vampire Queen," a sequence from Nift the Lean, winner of the 1983 World Fantasy Award. "Shea is one of the most visually powerful creators of horror images writing today." - Barron (ed), Horror Literature 4-269. Barron (ed), Fantasy and Horror 5-79. A fine copy in a fine dust jacket. (28581).

First edition. Octavo, cloth. Collects seven horror novellas including "The Autopsy" and "The Pearls of the Vampire Queen," a sequence from Nift the Lean, winner of the 1983 World Fantasy Award. "Shea is one of the most visually powerful creators of horror images writing today." - Barron (ed), Horror Literature 4-269. Barron (ed), Fantasy and Horror 5-79. A fine copy in a fine dust jacket. (28957).

First edition. Octavo, cloth. Review copy. Collects seven horror novellas including "The Autopsy" and "The Pearls of the Vampire Queen," a sequence from Nift the Lean, winner of the 1983 World Fantasy Award. "Shea is one of the most visually powerful creators of horror images writing today." - Barron (ed), Horror Literature 4-269. Barron (ed), Fantasy and Horror 5-79. A little foxing to top edge and for-edges, a fine copy in a fine dust jacket with a touch of rubbing at upper left front corner. Publisher's review slip and promotional material laid in. (28471).

First edition. Octavo, cloth. This copy signed by Shea, cover artist Harry O. Morris and foreword author Algis Budrys. Collects seven horror novellas including "The Autopsy" and "The Pearls of the Vampire Queen," a sequence from Nift the Lean, winner of the 1983 World Fantasy Award. "Shea is one of the most visually powerful creators of horror images writing today." - Barron (ed), Horror Literature 4-269. Barron (ed), Fantasy and Horror 5-79. A fine copy in a fine dust jacket with a tiny wrinkle at the upper left front corner. (28591).
